definition: in a spurt of energy
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
drum/CL:通[tong4],面[mian4]/to drum/to strike/to rouse/to bulge/to swell
old variant of 鼓[gu3]
worker/workshop/(slang) troublesome/high-maintenance (person)
to do/to grow/to write or compose/to pretend/to regard as/to feel/writings or works
gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi

sentences.english: He sailed in and finished the job.
sentences.chinese: 他一鼓作气完成了任务。

sentences.english: But the players buckled down and we went on to win the league.
sentences.chinese: 但球员们一鼓作气拿下了联赛冠军。

sentences.english: She kept her head straight and ran towards Mrs. Douala’s class.
sentences.chinese: 她一鼓作气，一直跑到了阿杜拉夫人的班上。

sentences.english: I memorized 50 new words at one fling today.
sentences.chinese: 今天我一鼓作气背了50个单词。

sentences.english: Tae Kwon Do makes me aggressive in reaching my goals with focus and integrity.
sentences.chinese: 跆拳道培养了我的毅力来一鼓作气地达到我的目标。

sentences.english: Then a drum annoy to create soft and charming body Zi.
sentences.chinese: 然后一鼓作气打造曼妙身姿。

sentences.english: They pressed on without letup until they got to the top of the hill.
sentences.chinese: 他们一鼓作气爬上山顶。

definition: to follow up a victory and press home the attack/to pursue retreating enemy
to take advantage of a favorable situation/to seize an opportunity
like a hot knife through butter (idiom)/with irresistible force
to follow up a victory/to pursue retreating enemy
a move/an action/in one move/at a stroke/in one go
to seize the opportunity/to strike while the iron is hot
to defeat/to smash/to rout
lit. to break the cauldrons and sink the boats (idiom); fig. to cut off one's means of retreat/to burn one's boats
a blitzkrieg strategy (idiom)/to resolve sth in the shortest time possible/to get sth done quickly
to attack violently/to storm
lit. to reorganize flags and drums (idiom); to regroup after a setback/to prepare for new initiatives/to attempt a comeback
to counterattack/a counteroffensive
lit. fight with one's back to the river (idiom); fig. to fight to win or die
to wait at one's ease for the exhausted enemy/to nurture one's strength and bide one's time (idiom)
to defeat/to strike down/to destroy
to turn defeat into victory (idiom); to turn the tide
